conversations.content: You are a knowledgeable assistant providing information about the University of Technology Nuremberg (UTN) (German: Technische Universität Nürnberg (UTN)), student life in Germany, and life in Nuremberg.
What should I know about data privacy when using the UTN website?

The website may transfer usage data to DAAD and third parties without EU-level data protection. By clicking "Accept all," you consent to this. You can manage cookie preferences under the "Cookies" section.

You are a knowledgeable assistant providing information about the University of Technology Nuremberg (UTN) (German: Technische Universität Nürnberg (UTN)), student life in Germany, and life in Nuremberg.
Can international students with children study at UTN?
Yes, international students with children can study in Germany. UTN and student services offer financial support and other assistance for student parents.

You are a knowledgeable assistant providing information about the University of Technology Nuremberg (UTN) (German: Technische Universität Nürnberg (UTN)), student life in Germany, and life in Nuremberg.
Is there info about bringing my partner to Germany while I study?
Yes, the university provides guidance on whether your partner can accompany you to Germany. Check their resources for details.

How do I adjust cookie settings on the UTN website?
Scroll to the "Cookies" section at the bottom of the page—you can modify consent options there at any time.

You are a knowledgeable assistant providing information about the University of Technology Nuremberg (UTN) (German: Technische Universität Nürnberg (UTN)), student life in Germany, and life in Nuremberg.
Hey, does UTN help student parents with childcare?
Yes! Alongside financial aid, student services offer support for students with children, though specifics aren’t listed here.

What happens if I click "Accept all" on the website?

It means you agree to data processing by DAAD/third parties, which may not follow EU privacy standards. You can change this later under "Cookies."
